description:
Simplify is re-imagining the hiring and job-searching process. We're democratizing finding a job, no matter what your background is, where you live or what school you attended.

Our first product is Copilot, and we're rapidly expanding on both the candidate and recruiter fronts. We've helped facilitate over 15m+ applications in just the last year, and are doubling down on our vision of building a common app for your career.

We started Simplify with the goal of killing the resume and allowing you to find roles that speak to you. Everything we build at Simplify is with a candidate-first approach, and designed to showcase the best version of yourself possible beyond your resume.
name: Simplify
tagline: The better way to job search.

updates.text:
This is a photo of my dad, editing his resume and applying to his first job in 2001 – while holding 1-year old me.

In the early 2000s, my dad was editing his resume in Microsoft Word and power-used Indeed to find and apply to jobs. 

He spent over a year job searching, eventually taking a role only slightly related to his degree and skills. 

But the process was so frustrating that my dad has been at the same job ever since – 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗻𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗹𝘆 𝟮𝟱 𝘆𝗲𝗮𝗿𝘀.

Now, in 2024, 𝗶𝘁’𝘀 𝗰𝗿𝗮𝘇𝘆 𝗵𝗼𝘄 𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘁𝗹𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗰𝗲𝘀𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝗳𝗶𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮 𝗷𝗼𝗯 𝗵𝗮𝘀 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗻𝗴𝗲𝗱.

You still edit your resume in Word, find roles on job boards that have looked the same since 2000, and fill out (often) hundreds of applications. 

It’s still time-consuming, inefficient, and 𝗡𝗢𝗧 candidate-friendly.

It’s sad that the biggest change in these photos is me – and not the way hiring is done. 𝗕𝘂𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝘀𝗵𝗼𝘂𝗹𝗱𝗻’𝘁 𝗯𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗰𝗮𝘀𝗲.

My dad's story is part of why I dropped out of Stanford to build Simplify – think of it as your 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗔𝗜-𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗮𝗴𝗲𝗻𝘁 that helps you 𝗼𝗿𝗴𝗮𝗻𝗶𝘇𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗳𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗷𝗼𝘂𝗿𝗻𝗲𝘆 and 𝗮𝗱𝘃𝗼𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗴𝗲𝘁 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗵𝗶𝗿𝗲𝗱.

Today, Simplify has helped over half a million candidates create over 1 million resumes and apply to over 40 million jobs.

We're on a mission to help 𝗘𝗩𝗘𝗥𝗬𝗢𝗡𝗘 find a job they truly love – in a way that doesn't make you want to pull your hair out.

If there’s one thing I wish I had known earlier in my job search, it’s Simplify—an AI-powered tool that automatically fills out your applications, matches you with jobs, assists with cover letters, and so much more. I’m such a fan that I tell all my friends to go premium—totally worth it!

Some might say using AI for job applications feels less genuine, but spending hours copying and pasting the same info (especially with Workday!) doesn't make the process more authentic, just less efficient.

What makes a job search genuine is focusing on:

✔️ Understanding the job description for the right fit
✔️ Researching companies you're applying to
✔️ Networking with people in roles you’re interested in

Simplify saves time and mental energy for what really matters. If you haven't checked it out yet, you should!

Shout out to Michael Yan and the Simplify team for creating such an awesome tool! 🙌

Layoffs are happening. Every day, I see amazing talent in my network back on the market. Having recently been on the market myself, a tip:

Use Simplify. 

(They are not paying me to say this. I don't know them. It's just really good.)

Deep into my job hunt, I kept reading best practices that mentioned tailoring my resume to each job and writing a flawless cover letter. Great, in theory! But I had to choose between submitting 10 good applications a day and 3-4 great ones. In this market, and with the financial clock ticking, I had to choose the 10. Until I didn't.

-Simplify used AI to tailor my existing resume based on keywords found in each individual job posting. (Take that, arbitrary applicant-tracking systems!) 

-It helped me generate similarly keyword-rich cover letters that I could then personalize. (You don't have to, but 100% AI-generated content is painful, obvious, and painfully obvious.) 

-It also suggested job openings for me based on some extremely selective parameters. (I'm picky!)

Bonus: it cost 40 bucks for a 3-month subscription (the length of the average job search), and I got hired well before the subscription ended. The peace of mind alone was worth the cost, knowing that some fickle robot wouldn't reject me out of hand because I said "copywriting" instead of "copy writing". 

So, for all my friends newly on the job hunt, save yourself some time and elbow grease. Use something like Simplify, so you can play the numbers game without sacrificing quality.

I met my cofounder at the Stanford dining hall my freshman year of college.

We became friends after unintentionally matching outfits and getting laughed at.

Later that year, we went through the brutal process of finding a job/internship. 

After 100s of applications, we decided to build a product to address some of the biggest challenges we faced in the job search (the prototype for Simplify!) 

One year later, Ethan and I both:  
• Dropped out of college (*the grad photo is fake, IYKYK)
• Turned down full-time job offers to do Y Combinator
• Moved to SF 

Today, we’ve built a platform that’s helped over half a million people apply to 40 million jobs. 

What I learned? Build companies with people who have a similar sense of fashion 🤠

*We have a third cofounder (Rushil) that also dresses similarly

𝗛𝗮𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮 𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗱 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲 𝗷𝗼𝗯 𝘀𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴?

This Thursday, I'lll be sitting down for a virtual chat with the Computer Science Club (CSC) at Pitt (aka the team behind the PittCSC Github list!)!

We'll be talking about everything relating to getting a tech job/internship in today's market, insights I've gotten from the 40 million applications submitted by Simplify users, and some of my experiences dropping out of Stanford to found a startup!

This talk will be virtual and everyone is welcome on 𝗧𝗵𝘂𝗿𝘀𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗢𝗰𝘁 𝟭𝟬 𝗮𝘁 𝟴:𝟭𝟱 𝗽𝗺 𝗘𝗦𝗧!

We'll also be giving away some fun prizes, so 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝘀𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗥𝗦𝗩𝗣 𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝘀 𝗚𝗼𝗼𝗴𝗹𝗲 𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺: https://lnkd.in/gdTm-x6R

See you soon! :)

***GIVEAWAY CLOSED*** 

Winners have been announced in the comments below! 

- 

📣 College Students: I’m giving away 𝗙𝗜𝗩𝗘 𝗦𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗳𝘆+ 𝘀𝘂𝗯𝘀𝗰𝗿𝗶𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 ($90 each!)

Last September, I spent over 𝟭𝟬𝟬+ 𝗵𝗼𝘂𝗿𝘀 job-searching while balancing college and a part-time job.

It was overwhelming, and I was spending hours re-entering my information on job applications every week. 

Later that year, a friend introduced me to Simplify and it was a game-changer for my job search. Simplify helped me autofill my job applications, tailor my resumes & cover letters, and track my entire job-search. 

Now that I’m a part of the Simplify team, 𝗜’𝗺 𝘀𝘂𝗽𝗲𝗿 𝗲𝘅𝗰𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝘁𝗼 𝗯𝗲 𝗴𝗶𝘃𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮𝘄𝗮𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝘀𝗲 𝗦𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗳𝘆+ 𝘀𝘂𝗯𝘀𝗰𝗿𝗶𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀 to help support your job search this September.

𝗪𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝘁𝗼 𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗿? 𝗛𝗲𝗿𝗲’𝘀 𝗵𝗼𝘄: 👇 

1️⃣ Be a current college student at a U.S. institution

2️⃣ Follow me (Kevin) on LinkedIn & make sure you're signed up on Simplify (it's free!)

3️⃣ Comment one sentence about how Simplify has helped you! (e.g., “Simplify saved me a TON of time on job applications!”) 

𝗜'𝗹𝗹 𝗯𝗲 𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗼𝗺𝗹𝘆 𝘀𝗲𝗹𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝟱 𝘄𝗶𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗮𝗻𝗻𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗺 𝗼𝗻 𝟵/𝟮𝟰! 

Good luck – I can’t wait to read the comments! :)
